page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: Huntingdon{railway}station leads out to many of the main lines.It handles quite a few types of trains,including Inter City 125,HST,diesel, etc. There is a cafe on the platform,also a small waiting-room and a ticket office.People use trains on Saturdays for shopping in{Peterborough}or in {London}e.g. Brent Cross,Knightsbridge. The direct rail link to London takes only{40 minutes.}During the week the prime use of the station is for {commuters}travelling to work in London. You buy your ticket from the main ticket office.When you go onto the platform to get the train,your ticket has to be punched by the ticket collector.To become a ticket collector you have to study for 3 weeks.An average of{1300}people go through the station in a day.
